sect2.title: Configuring DNS
sect2.para: DNS servers have a very special task in networking. They translate hostnames (for instance www.libranet.com) to IP addresses. To be able to use hostnames the system needs access to one or more DNS servers. Alsmost all internet service providers provide DNS servers. DNS can be configured by selecting expert and then nameserver in the adminmenu network configuration. Adminmenu will then ask for the nameservers (). You can enter the IP adresses in the input field, seperating them with a space.
